intro: The v-list component is used to display information. It can contain an avatar, content, actions, subheaders and much more. Lists present content in a way that makes it easy to identify a specific item in a collection. They provide a consistent styling for organizing groups of text and images.

flat.heading: Flat
flat.intro: Items donâ€™t change when selected in v-list with flat property.

nav.heading: Nav
nav.intro: Lists can receive an alternative nav styling that reduces the width v-list-item takes up as well as adding a border radius.

shaped.heading: Shaped
shaped.intro: Shaped lists have rounded borders on one side of the v-list-item.

subgroup.heading: Sub group
subgroup.intro: Using the v-list-group component you can create up to 2 levels in depth using the sub-group prop.

three.heading: Three line
three.intro: For three line lists, the subtitle will clamp vertically at 2 lines and then ellipsis. This feature uses line-clamp and is not supported in all browsers.

two.heading: Two lines and subheader
two.intro: Lists can contain subheaders, dividers, and can contain 1 or more lines. The subtitle will overflow with ellipsis if it extends past one line.

expansion.heading: Expansion Lists
expansion.intro: A list can contain a group of items which will display on click utilizing v-item-group's activator slot. Expansion lists are also used within the v-navigation-drawer component.

action.heading: Action and item groups
action.intro: A three-line list with actions. Utilizing v-list-item-group, easily connect actions to your tiles.

stack.heading: Action stack
stack.intro: A list can contain a stack within an action. This is useful when you need to display meta text next to your action item.

card.heading: Card list
card.intro: A list can be combined with a card.

single.heading: Single line list
single.intro: Here we combine v-list-item-avatar and v-list-item-icon in a single-line list.

subheadings.heading: Subheadings and dividers
subheadings.intro: Lists can contain multiple subheaders and dividers.
